author: todd lappin
text: "the thunderbird is about bringing back the unbridled optimism of the 1950s," says j mays, vp of design at ford motor company. "it's a little bit naive, very optimistic, and very confident." it's also an automobile design that is less about brand and more about lifestyle. this is a new approach for mays, who spent 14 years in germany creating cars for audi and volkswagen and focusing on modernist, functional design. mays broke that tradition - and earned his giddy reputation - when he created the impossibly cute and wildly popular new beetle. then ford set him completely free: "i can be functionally driven one day, playful the next, and create a luxury car the next." the nostalgia-soaked thunderbird and the precious (my) mercury are just the latest of his creations. electric wordbody shopgod of thundersim bangepinion makersluminarypower trip
